item.title: Street light 4, 24th August
item.description:
Please could Street Light (pair of downlighters) Number 4, which is attached to the upper level of Queen's House shining down onto the terrace, be adjusted so that it is at the correct angle (ie. horizontal or whatever is suitable?). At the moment it is angled inwards towards the building. Please also check Number 5 (to the right) at the same time. They can be accessed via the Leicester Place entrance, Yun Bar/Club 404.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leicester Place, Chinatown, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bury Place j/w Gilbert Place, 24th August
item.description:
Surely the double dashed give way markings here should in fact be single edge-of-carriageway lines? I get that vehicles turning right onto Gilbert Place need to give priority to the cycle lane, but double thick dashes should be used for a junction from a side road onto a main road where the vehicle has to give way. Edge of carrriageway markings here would surely still mean that vehicles have to give way to the cycle way, thus being effective and correct.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gilbert Place, Bloomsbury, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: XL Damaged Plastic Sack Animal Waste Inside/ Hidden Garden Waste, 24th August
item.description:
In the right hand corner of the carpark (closest to Berwick Road) next to Welling School, a damaged sack containing multiple bags of animal poo waste has leaked across the spaces close to it. A black bag containing garden cuttings has also been hidden in the corner of the bushes there, too. Other litter that was in the area has been removed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Douglas Road, East Wickham, London

item.title: Graffiti sprayed on shop shutter at 6 Brixton road SW9 6BU., 24th August
item.description:
I like to report graffiti sprayed on a shop shutter at 6 Brixton road SW9 6BU. The graffiti is very large and very visible. The shop is called Your Choice Store. The graffiti has been there for over seven months or more. Please can it be painted over it brings down the look of the street. If it can be removed I would be very grateful.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Brixton Road, Oval, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cardboard boxes dumped on Lyme Grove cycle path, 24th August
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lyme Grove, Hackney, London

item.title: Union Flags erected at half mast on lamp posts, 24th August
item.description:
Please remove union flags taped to lamp posts on Nuxley Road DA17, and in Bexley Town Centre. I have no objection to flags including the national flag flying from public buildings, or from flag poles on property that people own. It is illegal under the Highways Act 1980 to erect flags on public property such as lamp posts. This creates a potential hazard to traffic, and Councils should remove these as part of normal street cleaning . Union flags erected along Nuxley Road DA17 are less than half way up the lamp posts, and many are upside down. This is an eyesore which does not improve the look or feel of my neighbourhood.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nuxley Road, Lessness Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet
